resources.string: Portland, OR
Back
Cafes
Restaurants
Shopping
Soro Soro
Umami Café
Proud Mary Cafe
Tanaka
Address: 2250 E Burnside St, Portland, OR 97214
Korean coffee shop culture in Portland, OR. Delicious classic desserts with some Asian fusion such as MATCHA T.
Address: 611 SW Kingston Dr, Portland, OR 97205

Here, you will experience the pairing of world-class Japanese tea with traditional gracious, attentive service, and delicious edible delights.With a design reminiscent of Kyoto’s Kiyomizu-dera temple, the Umami Café floats over the hillside and provides views of the area’s natural beauty.
Address: 2012 NE Alberta St, Portland, OR 97211

Proud Mary, which was founded in Australia, has established itself as the Portland leader for super prestigious, award-winning coffee beans. There are very few other places in the city that consistently carry Cup of Excellence honorees.
Address: 678 SW 12th Ave, Portland, OR 97205

Tanaka’s menus feature sweet and savory options. A focus is on katsu and a 70-year-old katsu sauce recipe, which vie for attention with shokupan bread, a light and fluffy milk bread baked in-house daily. Pastries are infused with flavors found in Japanese cuisine.
The Waffle Window
Chimcking
Kkoki KBBQ
Fire on the Mountain
Address: 3610 SE Hawthorne Blvd, Portland, OR 97214

Think you know waffles? Think again. This adorable and affordable eatery, housed in the Bread and Ink Cafe, serves homemade Belgian waffles like you have never had before. The menu features fun seasonal items as well as showcasing ingredients that are in season.
Address: 4118 NE Sandy Blvd, Portland, OR 97212

Are you ready to embark on a culinary adventure that combines crispy chicken and refreshing beer? Look no further than Chimcking Chicken and Beer, a Korean delight that has taken the food scene by storm.
Address: 8001 SE Powell Blvd O, Portland, OR 97206

Offering a range of authentic Korean food and beverage items such as angus prime rib, beef, chicken, pork, shrimp and noodle soup, additionally drinks such as Soju. It is a fun experience to grill and eat on the center of your table.
Address: 1708 E Burnside St, Portland, OR 97214

At this cheery, family-friendly “Original Buffalo Wing Joint,” the wings are served crispy and the dozen house-made sauces range from sweet to four alarm spicy. Like any savvy wing establishment, Fire on the Mountain offers both blue cheese and creamy ranch dressing with your meat—but like a true Portland wingding, it’s also concocted meatless alternatives.
Washington Square Mall
Pioneer Place
Lloyd Center
Clackamas Town Center
Address: 9585 SW Washington Square Rd, Portland, OR 97223

Washington Square is Oregon’s premier shopping center, offering uncompromising style and selection with four major department stores, including Oregon’s largest Nordstrom, and more than 170 specialty stores.
Address: 700 SW Fifth Avenue, Portland, OR 97204

Pioneer Place is the ultimate retail destination in the heart of Portland’s bustling business district. Whether you’re fitting in a quick shopping trip during your lunch break or planning to spend the day exploring the luxury retailers, you’re in for a treat at this unparalleled shopping destination.
Address: 2201 Lloyd Center, Portland, OR 97232

The mall features three floors of shopping, with the third level serving mostly as professional office spaces, a food court, and U.S. Education Corporations Carrington College. Lloyd Center also includes the Lloyd Center Ice Skating Rink, which has become the main draw for the mall.
Address: 12000 SE 82nd Ave, Happy Valley, OR 97086
A wide variety of shops, including A bookstore, major clothing stores and REI. A movie theater with many options, and about 12 screens. And plenty of restaurants.
